entity.name: グレェ「grey」
entity.description: オレはグレェでございます。I go by grey. I have been facilitating libre/free open source technologies since the 1970s. Incarnated as a human in Menlo Park, where my parents' church to this day still shares a parking lot with SRI [Stanford Research Institute] and I knew Doug Engelbart [behind NLS {oNLine System} and Bill English personally before they passed away, among other luminaries. As a teen, some of my cohorts and I were repeatedly invited to work on and improve systems at the Naval Postgraduate School in Monterey (now: nps.edu but then: nps.navy.mil). I encountered networked computers before TCP 'flag day' and was a (Co)SysOp on Citadel [open source older than the FSF] BBSes in the 408 area code such as WWWA, VisionSoft, SoL [Satellite of Love], Cathode Cathedral, TOWN 303 and more before helping with fledging web presences in the early 1990s. In more recent decades I have been a contributing editor to the OpenBSD Journal [https://undeadly.org] as well as a maintainer of various MacPorts [https://ports.macports.org/search/?selected_facets=maintainers_exact:artkiver] mostly down-streaming code from OpenBSD related projects to macOS/OS X. I was also previously a sysadmin at iXSystems [behind FreeNAS/TrueNAS and one of the larger funders of the FreeBSD project], a co-founder of the SF based hacker space https://noisebridge.net, staff at RECon.cx in 2006 and I have also presented at https://toorcon.org among sundry related activities

projects.name: MacPorts
projects.description: Originally created as DarwinPorts, co-founded by luminaries such as jkh (Jordan Hubbard, one of the co-founders of the FreeBSD project), MacPorts is in essence to macOS/OS X what /usr/ports is to a BSD UNIX like operating system. Currently nearly 40,000 software packages are maintained by hundreds of contributors. Personally I tend to focus primarily on down streaming code from upstream OpenBSD related projects such as: OpenSSH, LibreSSL, signify, OpenSMTPD, etc..
licenses: various, MIT, ISC, BSD, GPL, etc.

channels.description: Will accept ACH to my Credit Union. Please e-mail me for details.
Pay with your debit/credit card through this libre/free open source payment gateway and setup recurring subscriptions.
Pay with your debit/credit card through this closed source proprietary PayPal payment gateway.

plans.name: Hosting support
plans.description: This will cover the monthly server hosting costs for the projects.

plans.name: Developer compensation
plans.description: This will cover the cost of one developer working part-time on the projects.

plans.name: Goodwill plan
plans.description: Pay anything you wish to show your goodwill for the project.

history.description: Let's see if anyone donates this way?
